intro: Alsinanthus scaber, commonly known as roughweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. Alsinanthus scaber is an important plant for local pollinators and has been used traditionally by Indigenous peoples for various purposes.
